reviews.review: A triumph of storytelling in the medium of film and the genre of a shared cinematic universe.
Loved all the Avengers together! Thor and Star Lord are hilarious together. Great movie!

It was the best marvel movie that came out since the winter solider. It was high action the all way through the movie. Really enjoyed the comical parts of the movie, it tied in nicely with the movie and the characters! Ps. Teenage Groot was a funny addition.
The best superhero movie ever created.
An impressive spectacle. Nice to see them take some risks both in outcomes and characterization.
And boom goes the dynamite. Marvel /Disney does it again. It doesn't seem fair to Warner at this point.
I bought my tickets over a month ago. the hype was way too much to live up to. the movie sprints from battle to battle, way too over-ambitious. entertaining, but left a lot to be desired.

Infinity War is a storytelling feat. Despite featuring over 20 characters in 2.5 hours, the Russo brothers are able to tell a story that contains a surprising amount of maturity and nuance (for a Marvel superhero movie). That being said, the movie does expect the audience to have kept up with the main events of the MCU and to enter the theater already invested in the characters and their story arcs. 

The action scenes are plot-driven and purposeful. At no point will the audience ask, "Why are they fighting again?" as has been the case with some other recent superhero films. The action was fantastic, in the literal sense of the word. For some viewers (like myself), the reliance on CGI may render the action scenes less impactful. Consequently, there is nothing in this movie that will equal the highway knife fight or the elevator fight scenes from Winter Soldier. 

The fresh character interactions are what make the movie truly enjoyable. Several characters are only given a handful of lines in the movie but the writing and delivery make their presence felt. Tom Holland, in particular, makes excellent use of his screen time.

The irony is, that in a movie that captures the Avengers at the 11th hour, too many of the critical moments of the film are rushed. Moreover, some of the inevitable send offs may not have the emotional impact you would expect.
